data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Since you always face forward, the instructions tell you to always face forward. By the way, you can not face to the left and the right when walking. So, the answer is No.

Turned around means to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You can return to the starting point by walking around at a normal speed of 15mph. Therefore, the answer is no.

The first step is to take 6 steps, take 2 steps to go back to the starting point. The second step is to turn around and take 8 steps. The third step is to take 2 steps to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The first step forward is the first and last step forward. The steps taken to the left are the first, fourth and last steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

You repeat what you did step one, then repeat what you did step two more times, then repeat what you did step three more times, and so on. If you return to the starting point you are not necessarily going home. So, the answer is no.

The starting is always facing forward. This indicates that one needs to take 1 step backward before taking 3 steps forward. To return to an original starting point, you would only need to take 2 steps forward. Thus, the answer is No.

There are 36 steps in the first set of instructions. If you take 6 steps backward the first step is 36 steps backward. In the second set of instructions you start with 8 steps right and 4 steps backward. Each step backward is 6 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.
